key_title: Key to the species of Cheilanthes

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants
Key to the genera of Pteridaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Undersurface of pinnules generally without hairs; scales absent or sparse; lamina light to dark green
Undersurface of pinnules thickly beset with hairs and/or scales; lamina dark green to grey-green
Lamina mostly 3–10 cm wide, triangular to ovate, 3-pinnate; pinnae close together; undersurface of rachis and midrib with scattered fine scales and few hairs

Lamina mostly 2–3 cm wide, oblong to ovate, 2-pinnate (or 3-pinnate near base); pinnae well separated; undersurface of rachis and midrib with scattered segmented hairs (many appressed and glandular) and few scales
Undersurface of pinnules covered in flat scales; upper surface of pinnules with small, sparse, simple hairs
Undersurface of pinnules with fine scales and numerous branched hairs; upper surface of pinnules with moderate to dense cover of branched hairs
